H0.text: The fibula, a slender bone on the lateral side of the leg, does not bear weight, unlike the larger tibia on the medial side.

H1.text: Resist weight is not a function of the fibula, a slender bone on the lateral side of the leg, whereas the tibia is the larger, weight‑bearing bone located on the medial side of the leg.

H2.text: Support weight is the function that the fibula does not perform, unlike the tibia, which is the larger, weight‑bearing bone on the medial side of the leg.

H3.text: The fibula, the slender bone on the lateral side of the leg, does not drive weight, unlike the tibia, which is the larger weight‑bearing bone located on the medial side of the leg.

A4.text: The fibula does not carry any significant load (weight) of the body.

A5.text: As much of the fibula can be removed without it impacting an individual's ability to walk, the fibula is utilised as a source of bone material in fibular free flap surgeries.
